body: You might want to confirm that things are ok in  the upcoming new UI under `www_rbac`
Ready for me to merge?
You could also close and reopen the pr to retrigger the travis to run. Sometimes it is due to transient issue from travis CI side.
Woooooooo @mistercrunch is doing a commit! Hear hear! @Fokko ðŸ‘
![Awesome](https://www.desicomments.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/Awesome-Nice-Image.jpg)

@feng-tao, let's not and have @milton0825 setup Travis on his own fork and point to the successful result. Apache Infra has reached out to us to explain we are consuming to much compute time on Travis...
LGTM!
Closing PR.. also.. please follow our contribution guidelines in the future.

Could you rebase against master? I see a lot of changes, also some files that look unrelated, like the python operator.

@gglanzani Hive master, can you take a peek?
Thank you @Fokko for taking a look. I was working on making the PR pass the CI, will update the PR description later to provide more context on this change.
~We've been using redis for this for almost a year with no problems. Does anyone have an actual reason to discourage it's use?~ Edit: ignore me, we use redis for broker transport, not the results.

I'm a little confused here.  As far as i  understood, the jinja2 templating isn't an actual solution for Windows, because the format of the `ts` variable is always in isoformat.  Given that the default is this:

`FILENAME_TEMPLATE = '{{ ti.dag_id }}/{{ ti.task_id }}/{{ ts }}/{{ try_number }}.log'`

What could a Windows user realistically replace this with? Perhaps:

`FILENAME_TEMPLATE = '{{ ti.dag_id }}/{{ ti.task_id }}/{{ try_number }}.log'` 

In which case you lose the timestamp altogether.  If there is support from airflow devs, i would like to submit a PR around adding an additional variable, for example `safe_ts` which strips illegal NTFS characters from the string.  Perhaps it could be:

`FILENAME_TEMPLATE = '{{ ti.dag_id }}/{{ ti.task_id }}/{{ safe_ts }}/{{ try_number }}.log'`

edit: Nevermind, i see FILENAME_TEMPLATE itself is never exposed for configuration in the first place - why not? Seems like a logical thing to do.

Cheers

Hi Dan,

I'm actually using:

FILENAME_TEMPLATE = '{{ ti.dag_id }}/{{ ti.task_id }}/{{ ts |
replace(":",".") }}/{{ try_number }}.log'

seems to work fine on windows/ntfs.

Niels

This looks good (and the re-init trick is nice). Could you rebase/resolve and then I'll be able to merge.

Oh and mention me once done please!
@jgao54 We can close this PR now can't we?

Thanks for taking a look @Fokko! Rebased the PR.

> this only happens when using kerberos

Not only in that case unfortunately. impyla always requires `thrift_sasl`, even without kerberos.

https://github.com/cloudera/impyla/blob/6980dda32350f0b43d2069978815e515a04283e4/impala/_thrift_api.py#L149
Please follow the contribution guidelines.

@Fokko we have a use case for backfill such that we want to use the values passed through CLI in the SQL instead of the values defined in params.

Let's look at the following example
```
templated_command = """
    echo "text = {{ dag_run.conf.text if dag_run.conf.text else params.text }}"
"""

bash_operator = BashOperator(
    task_id='bash_task',
    bash_command=templated_command,
    dag=dag,
    params={"text": "normal processing"}
    )
```

In the daily processing we will have the following output:
```
test = normal processing
```

In the backfill if we pass {"text": "backfill processing"}, we will have the output:
```
test = backfill processing
```

I hope this answers your question!

```
from airflow.www_rbac.security import AirflowSecurityManager
user_model = SecurityManager.user_model
```

I can confirm, with this patch, if I use in airflow.cfg:

```
executor = CeleryExecutor
broker_url = sqla+mysql://airflow:x1g@localhost:3306/airflow
```

then the worker starts with:

```
                                                                                                                                                             
 -------------- celery@localhost.localdomain v4.1.1 (latentcall)                                                                                             
---- **** -----                                                                                                                                              
--- * ***  * -- Linux-4.16.11-300.fc28.x86_64-x86_64-with-fedora-28-Twenty_Eight 2018-05-25 14:36:22                                                         
-- * - **** ---                                                                                                                                              
- ** ---------- [config]                                                                                                                                     
- ** ---------- .> app:         airflow.executors.celery_executor:0x7f6db7b4bf50                                                                             
- ** ---------- .> transport:   sqla+mysql://airflow:x1g@localhost:3306/airflow                                                                              
- ** ---------- .> results:     mysql://airflow:**@localhost:3306/airflow                                                                                    
- *** --- * --- .> concurrency: 16 (prefork)                                                                                                                 
-- ******* ---- .> task events: OFF (enable -E to monitor tasks in this worker)                                                                              
--- ***** -----                                                                                                                                              
 -------------- [queues]                                                                                                                                     
                .> default          exchange=default(direct) key=default                                                                                     
```

Instead of throwing an exception about bad arguments being passed to the backend.

I was also able to trigger a dag and verify that it ran.

Thanks for reviewing and committing @jgao, but really sorry, I've just noticed I had a mistake.
Opening a file with 'w+' mode truncates it first, so COPY FROM breaks the input file and loads no data. My test was incomplete.

I'll send an additional PR soon, so would you take a look? I'll add a new parameter to `PostgresHook.copy_expert` for specifying file open mode.
It might be possible to decide file opening mode by parsing sql, but I don't think it's a good idea, since naive implementation (using regex, for example) is flaky.
@jgao54 Would you take a look? Sorry for taking your time.

@Fokko if `visibility_timeout` is set to something else, it gets picked up in the code here: https://github.com/rodrigc/incubator-airflow/blob/22fa32aea2bc5c4f54011d0af986c0608340b28c/airflow/config_templates/default_celery.py#L35 and gets set in `broker_transport_options`.

The `broker_transport_options` are then passed to the backend in `airflow/executors/celery_executor.py`
I am looking forward to having this PR merged! The requirement for running the unit test should be simple and straightforward.

> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3430?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [11e670d...0203d7c](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3430?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

@Fokko  PTAL. The kubernetes section in the configuration file supports the **dags_volume_subpath** parameter, but **logs_volume_subpath** does not support. If both are supported, the dags and the logs volume can use the same pvc, sharing the same backend storage that support mounted by multiple pod (e.g. NFS), only different subpaths. So, I added **logs_volume_subpath**  parameter support.
